title: 5D Torus
summary: 5D Torus is a 4th tier tradeable.
game_description:
A specially manufactured container of five-dimensional tori.

Highly specific materials are required to construct shapes in extra dimensions. These tori are used to contain the strong fields generated in the manufacture of scientific components.
source_info:
*It can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all high-wealth Advanced Materials Economy star systems.
*It is also obtainable in some, but not all, medium-wealth systems with this Economy.
*Can be gifted from Iteration: Hesperus in the Space Anomaly.
use_info:
*Five Dimensional Torus can be sold for a profit in any Scientific Economy star system.
*It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
*It can be use as a replacement in delivery missions.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Stack size in Exosuit general inventory raised from 1 to 5. It has the same icon as Containment Failure and Shattered Power Core.
* Waypoint - Renamed, formerly "Five Dimensional Torus"; type changed, formerly "Advanced Construction Materials".

title: Albumen Pearl
summary:
|thumb|Albumen Pearls are found in Humming Sacs
Albumen Pearl is a trade commodities.

It is a valuable gemstone most frequently found enclosed inside of Humming Sacs, which are shells that resemble plants. It currently has no use other than trading.
game_description:
Gemstone formed over the course of centuries within the egg of a super-incubatory species. Highly ornamental, these gems are themselves living seeds, lucent grains of potential life.

Can be sold at a Galactic Trade Terminal.
source_info: * Albumen Pearls are most reliably sourced in Farmer, Albumen Pearls can also be grown as a product of the Albumen Pearl Orb plant, with a harvest time of 2 hours.
release_history:
* Foundation - plants now register on the scanner 
* wanted level
* Prisms - value changed, was 9,025.0
additional_info: *If it stored in the inventory, scanning pirates will target the player during spaceflight. Many players have reported getting involved in large scale space battles when having large quantities of Albumen Pearls.

infobox.desc: Valuable green gem stone found in shells

title: Aronium
summary: AroniumÂ is a tradeable.
game_description:
A lightweight and highly malleable alloy. Crafted from Paraffinium and Ionised Cobalt.

In high demand on the Galactic Trade Network due to its utility in the construction of planetside outposts and facilities.
source_info: *Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250
release_history: * Interceptor - Corrected description to list the correct crafting ingredients.

title: Atlas Seed
summary:
There are different seeds, and each seed requires the previous one as a crafting component. After visiting the 11th Atlas Interface and activating it, it will ask for the last seed, Heart of the Sun, in order to complete the Atlas Path. Once you give it the Heart of the Sun, you get the choice to give birth to a new star.

This game path can only be done once.
source_info: You receive the first crafting blueprint for an Atlas Seed after interacting with an Atlas Interface for the first time, and an additional blueprint for each one visited. Be sure to have the Atlas Path selected in your mission log prior to visiting an Atlas Interface. Attempting otherwise may cause it to glitch out.
additional_info:
*To complete the Atlas path, you will require the following resources (in total):
** 125 Chromatic Metal
** 100 Pure Ferrite
** 100 Ionised Cobalt
** 5 Magnetised Ferrite
** 100 Copper
** 100 Cadmium
** 100 Emeril
** 100 Indium
** 100 Gold

* Additionally, you will need to craft a Cadmium Drive, an Emeril Drive, and an Indium Drive in order to collect Cadmium, Emeril, and Indium, respectively.
* Upon completion of the Atlas Path, you're given a new mission to proceed to a Black Hole. Black holes are now visible on the Galactic Map.
* Completing the quest consumes the Heart of the Sun.
* If you save your game after completing the Atlas Path before proceeding to complete the Black Hole quest and restart the game, you may need to jump to the next Atlas Interface and "Birth a New Star" again for the quest to be considered complete. Even though Black Holes will be visible on the map. (Possible bug in v1.35)

title: Autonomous Positioning Unit
summary: Autonomous Positioning Unit is a 4th tier tradeable.
game_description:
A container of positioning units and associated wiring.

These APS units can be used to turn virtually any technology into a self-navigating system. Highly valuable in power generation economies, where they're used to remove conductive organic hands from the manufacturing process.
source_info: Autonomous Positioning Unit can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all high-wealth Technology Economy star systems. It is also obtainable in some, but not all, medium-wealth systems with this Economy.
use_info:
Autonomous Positioning Unit can be sold for a profit in any Power Generation Economy star system.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Stack size in Exosuit general inventory raised from 1 to 5.
* Waypoint - Type changed, formerly "Technology Parts".

title: Banned Weapons
summary: Banned Weapons is a tradeable item.
game_description:
Hacked together from the salvaged remains of Sentinel forces, these potent weapons are a favourite of outlaws across the galaxy.

Purchase is illegal at nearly all galactic trade terminals. Regular supply is only available within outlaw systems.

Selling banned goods into commercially-regulated space may be highly profitable.
source_info: Purchaseable in outlaw systems.
use_info:
Component is useful only to be sold at a Trade Terminal.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history: *Outlaws - Added to the game.
additional_info: Selling in non-outlaw systems provides a price mark-up of +150% - +180%.

title: Blood Salt
summary: Blood Salt is a tradeable item.
game_description:
Jars of murky, foul-smelling crystals. Produced in viscous evaporation traps, these organic salts are used in the manufacture of illegal pheromones.

Purchase is illegal at nearly all galactic trade terminals. Regular supply is only available within outlaw systems.

Selling banned goods into commercially-regulated space may be highly profitable.
source_info: Purchaseable in outlaw systems.
use_info:
Component is useful only to be sold at a Trade Terminal.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history: *Outlaws - Added to the game.
additional_info: Selling in non-outlaw systems provides a price mark-up of +150% - +180%.

title: Captured Nanode
summary:
Captured Nanode is a curiosity, also known as the 1st of 10 unique Atlas Seeds.
It has an important part in The Atlas Path mission and it is worth 1,000
game_description: Atlas Seed containing zonally-shifted quasi-stellar substrate. Warning: do not allow matrix to commune with this dimensional space.
source_info: The blueprint is given after talking to an Pathfinder or above is required.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a curiosity.
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Iridium.

title: Comet Droplets
summary: Comet Droplets are a 3rd tier tradeable.
game_description:
Several canisters of comet droplets.

An elaborate trading name for chunks of meteorite, these rocks are nonetheless extremely valuable to the advanced material economies that can process them.
source_info: Comet Droplets can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all medium-wealth and high-wealth Trading Economy star systems. They are also offered as a reward for doing missions at the Mission Board.
use_info:
Comet Droplets can be sold for a profit in any Advanced Materials Economy star system.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Stack size in Exosuit general inventory raised from 1 to 5. It has the same icon as Explosive Drones and Solenoid.
* Waypoint - Type changed, formerly "Trade Commodity".

title: Convergence Cube
summary: Convergence Cube is a trade commodities.
game_description: Device used by the Korvax for the storage of historical and cultural information.
source_info:
* It can be found in Damaged Containers or as monolith rewards. 
* It can be purchased from NPCs at Trading Posts in Korvax systems.
* It is a possible reward from frigate expeditions.
* It is a possible trade from wandering traders you encounter while using the Pulse Engine.
* It can be given by a Korvax space station exploration guild envoy, if you have a sufficient exploration guild rank.
* It can be sold by landed NPC pilots
release_history:
* Release - Introduced to the game.
* NEXT - Value changed, previously it was worth 13,062.5
additional_info:
* It can be sold at the Galactic Trade Terminal.
* One is required during the Scientific Research to progress further in the mission.
* Three are required to purchase a Korvax Settlement.

title: Counterfeit Circuits
summary: Counterfeit Circuits is a tradeable item.
game_description:
Reversed-engineered from a captured space station core, these unlicensed circuits are used in a wide range of black- and grey-market technologies.

Purchase is illegal at nearly all galactic trade terminals. Regular supply is only available within outlaw systems.

Selling banned goods into commercially-regulated space may be highly profitable.
source_info:
* Purchaseable in outlaw systems
* From freighter fleets in outlaw systems
* Can be found in Storage Containers aboard Crashed Freighters
* Missions from the Bounty Master aboard outlaw space stations
release_history: *Outlaws - Added to the game.
additional_info:
*Component can be sold at a Trade Terminal.
*Selling in non-outlaw systems provides a price mark-up of +150% - +180%.

title: Dark Matter
summary:
Dark Matter is a curiosity, also known as the 4th of 10 unique Atlas Seeds.
It has an important part in The Atlas Path mission and it is worth 1,000
game_description: An Atlas Seed shell encompassing a void element harvested from the collapse state of the last universe. Toxic if ingested.
source_info: The blueprint is given after talking to an Cassini or above is required.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a curiosity.
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Noospheric Orb and Aluminium.

title: Dawn's End
summary:
'''Dawn's End''' is a curiosity, also known as the 5th of 10 unique Atlas Seeds.
It has an important part in The Atlas Path mission and it is worth 1,000
game_description: Sculpted tau neutrino-boson matrix fixed within an irreplaceable Atlas Seed shell. May be semi-sentient.
source_info: The blueprint is given after talking to an Kepler or above is required.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a curiosity.
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Dark Matter and Gold.

title: De-Scented Bottles
summary: De-Scented Bottles is a 1st tier tradeable.
game_description:
A loose collection of recycled pheromone bottles.

Vast quantities of pheromones are produced and distributed every day. This has spawned a lucrative trading opportunity for those willing to deal with the waste products. These glass jars have been thoroughly scrubbed and should pose no threat to the carrier.
source_info: De-Scented Bottles can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all Scientific Economy star systems.
use_info:
De-Scented Bottles can be sold for a profit in any Trading Economy star system.

It is also used as an upgrade material for some Planetary Settlement buildings.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or  Base building.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Stack size in Exosuit general inventory raised from 1 to 5.
* Waypoint - Renamed, formerly "De-Scented Pheromone Bottle". Type changed, formerly "Scientific Components".

title: Decommissioned Circuits
summary: Decommissioned Circuits is a 1st tier tradeable.
game_description:
A collection of salvaged circuitry.

Power generation economies go through vast numbers of high-tech components. As such, the demand is present even for highly damaged circuits, to be scavenged for parts or just plugged wholesale into low-quality power cores.
source_info: Decommissioned Circuits can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all Technology Economy star systems.
use_info:
Decommissioned Circuits can be sold for a profit in any Power Generation Economy star system.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Stack size in Exosuit general inventory raised from 1 to 5. It has the same icon as Damaged Wiring and Power Distributor.
* Waypoint - Renamed, formerly "Decommissioned Circuit Board". Type changed, formerly "Technology Parts".
additional_info: * Same icon is used by Once-Useful Springs

title: Decrypted User Data
summary: Decrypted User Data is a 1st tier tradeable.
game_description:
A crate packed with hard drives, each of which contain vast amounts of decrypted user data.

Individually of low value, taken together these repositories can be processed and scanned for valuable data. This processing occurs in systems with advanced material economies.
source_info: Decrypted User Data can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all Trading Economy star systems.
use_info:
Decrypted User Data can be sold for a profit in any Advanced Materials Economy star system.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Stack size in Exosuit general inventory raised from 1 to 5.
* Waypoint - Type changed, formerly "Trade Commodity".

title: Dirty Bronze
summary: Dirty Bronze is a tradeable that can be crafted or purchased.
game_description:
A popular metal alloy with a wide variety of uses. 'Dirty Bronze' has shed its scientific name in favor of the popular term for its colour.

Crafted from Pure Ferrite and Pyrite.
source_info: *Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a component.
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Iron and Copper. Now it can also be refined and crafted.
* Prisms - Added Synthesis Laboratory as a blueprint source.

title: Englobed Shade
summary:
Englobed Shade is a curiosity, also known as the 2nd of 10 unique Atlas Seeds.

It has an important part in The Atlas Path mission and it is worth 1,000
game_description: This Atlas Shell holds the remains of a parasitic space-borne lifeform, most likely of extra-dimensional origins.
source_info: The blueprint is given after talking to an Juno or above is required.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a curiosity.
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Captured Nanode and Copper.

title: Enormous Metal Cog
summary: Enormous Metal Cog is a 1st tier tradeable.
game_description:
Several huge cogs.

Sturdy, well-made metal gears. While not advanced technology themselves, they're a vital component in countless pieces of high-tech machinery all over the galaxy.
source_info: Enormous Metal Cog can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all Manufacturing Economy star systems.
use_info:
Enormous Metal Cog can be sold for a profit in any Technology Economy star system.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.

It is an upgrade material for some Planetary Settlement buildings.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Introduced as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Stack size in Exosuit general inventory raised from 1 to 5.
* Waypoint - Type changed, formerly "Industrial Components".
* Beacon - Used as upgrade material for new settlement building upgrade process.

title: Experimental Power Fluid
summary: Experimental Power Fluid is a 4th tier tradeable.
game_description:
Corrosion-resistant barrels of an experimental power fluid.

One barrel of this highly volatile concoction is enough to power a space station for weeks on end. Particularly valued by mining economies.
source_info: Experimental Power Fluid can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all high-wealth Power Generation Economy star systems. It is also obtainable in some, but not all, medium-wealth systems with this Economy.
use_info:
Experimental Power Fluid can be sold for a profit in any Mining Economy star system.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Stack size in Exosuit general inventory raised from 1 to 5.
* Waypoint - Type changed, formerly "Tradable Energy Source".

title: First Spawn Relics
summary: First Spawn Relics is a tradeable item.
game_description:
Relics of the fallen Gek empire, condemned and banned by all the galaxy's major civilisations.

Purchase is illegal at nearly all galactic trade terminals. Regular supply is only available within outlaw systems.

Selling banned goods into commercially-regulated space may be highly profitable.
source_info: Purchaseable in outlaw systems.
use_info:
Component is useful only to be sold at a Trade Terminal.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history: *Outlaws - Added to the game.
additional_info: Selling in non-outlaw systems provides a price mark-up of +150% - +180%.

title: Fusion Core
summary: Fusion Core is a 5th tier tradeable.
game_description:
A slightly glowing bundle of fusion cores.

Power source, engine, high-capacity heater. A fusion core is the ultimate in deep-space power generation. Highly valued by mining economies looking to make their asteroid colonies more self-sufficient.
source_info: Fusion Core can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all high-wealth Power Generation Economy star systems.
use_info:
Fusion Core can be sold for a profit in any Mining Economy star system.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Stack size in Exosuit general inventory raised from 1 to 5. It has the same icon as Fuel Oxidiser and Load Balancer.
* Waypoint - Type changed, formerly "Tradable Energy Source".

title: Fusion Ignitor
summary:
thumb|Crafting Tree
Fusion Ignitor is a tradeable that can be crafted.
game_description:
A highly advanced piece of technology for use in the next generation of power plants. Producing a fusion core requires both intricate scientific skills and complex industrial processes.

Crafted from Portable Reactor, Quantum Processors and Geodesite.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from Manufacturing Facilites or purchased from the Synthesis Laboratory for 250
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a product.
* Visions - Value changed, previously it was worth 18,000,000.0
additional_info: It is tied with the Stasis Device for most valuable singular item in the game.

title: GekNip
summary: GekNip is a trade commodities.
game_description:
Edible product much beloved by the Gek.

Allows beaked traders to release delightfully scented packets of gas for a prolonged period of time.

GekNip gas packets are considered an art form, and the truest representation of the Gek soul.
source_info:
*It can be found in Damaged Containers or as monolith rewards. 
*It can also be bought from NPCs in Trading Posts.
*It is a possible reward from frigate expeditions.
*It is also a possible trade from wandering traders you encounter while using the Pulse Engine .
*It is a possible reward from Practice Language with Geks
release_history:
* Atlas Rises 1.37 - A blueprint was introduced for it a short time, making it craftable.
* Living Ship - Added Space Encounter with traders as a possible source.
additional_info: * They can be used to invest in Gek Planetary Settlements.

title: Geodesite
game_description: Geodesite is a tradeable that is used for crafting.
source_info: *Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a component.
* NEXT - Now it can also be refined.
* Prisms - Added Synthesis Laboratory as a blueprint source.

A highly valuable ore chunk, ready to be processed into Gold.

Select in the inventory (
source_info: Destroying asteroids
release_history: * Beyond - Added as a curiosity.

title: GrahGrah
summary: GrahGrah is a tradeable item.
game_description:
A canister of the now-banned Vy'keen battle gas, traditionally inhaled on the eve of battle.

Purchase is illegal at nearly all galactic trade terminals. Regular supply is only available within outlaw systems.

Selling banned goods into commercially-regulated space may be highly profitable.
source_info: Purchaseable in outlaw systems.
use_info:
Component is useful only to be sold at a Trade Terminal.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
additional_info:
*Selling in non-outlaw systems provides a price mark-up of +150% - +180%.
*An earlier (and now obsolete) version of this product can be viewed at Grahgrah.

title: Grantine
summary: GrantineÂ is a tradeable.
game_description:
Soft workable alloy favored by artisans throughout the known galaxy. Crafted from Ionised Cobalt and Dioxite.

A popular trading good, with many galactic shipping paths devoted to its sale and transport.
source_info: *Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250
release_history:
* Release - Added as a component.
* Atlas Rises - Blueprint changed, formerly used Iridium, Copper, and Aronium.
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Emeril and Heridium. Now it can also be refined.
* Prisms - Added Synthesis Laboratory as a blueprint source.
additional_info: It is probably named after Grant Duncan, a co-founder of Hello Games.

title: Gravitino Ball
summary:
Gravitino Ball is a trade commodities

As the player walks closer to one, it will shine brighter. It can be found in small, medium, and large varieties. 

It can be revealed with 35px icon.

When a Gravitino Ball is picked up in the wild, the player receives a three-star wanted level. There is no risk gathering them from your base or freighter hydroponics, and are a great cash crop when grown en masse.
game_description:
A supersymmetric particle cluster created by divergent super-gravitational forces. A micro-rift is created as they form, and extraction of the orb prompts a localised reality weakening. Sentinel forces will respond to stablise any such anomaly.

Can be sold at a Galactic Trade Terminal.
source_info:
thumb|The Gravitino Ball in a natural habitat. It only shines brightly when the player is near.
thumb|Sentient Plants on a frozen world
* Gravitino Balls will always spawn on planets with hostile or corrupted sentinels.
* They can also be found from a rock-like creature with a stalk holding a Gravitino Ball. These are called Light Stalk found around Xen in the game Half-Life.
* Several can also be found at certain Ancient Ruins.
* With assistance from a Farmer, Gravitino Balls can also be grown as a product of the Gravitino Host plant, with a harvest time of 120 minutes.
*Can be found on Frigate expeditions
release_history:
*Release - Released as part of the original game
*NEXT - value changed to 12,445.0, was 27,500.0
*Prisms - value changed to 40,024.0, was previously 12,445.0
additional_info: The value can be calculated as being 40,023.5 units, due to the fact that a stack of 10 gravitino balls is worth 400,235 units. When stacked, the value is displayed as "40,024". When not stacked, the value is displayed as "40,023". Only the 10x stack has enough data to provide the real accurate value.

title: Hadal Core
summary: Hadal Core is a tradeable.
game_description:
A highly-pressurised fleshy orb.

One can feel it push back when touched, a flash of bioluminescence stirring in the inky black core of this mysterious object.
source_info:
* Up to five pieces can be acquired from an Abyssal Horror to appear, destroying the remaining cores. 
* Can be found in Derelict Freighter containers.
* Can be found in the form of Submerged Relics (one piece).
* From Suspicious Packet (Goods).
* From Nexus and Mission Board Missions.
* As a gift from Planetary Settlement visitors.
release_history:
* Abyss 1.71 - Icon changed.
* Visions - Hidden changes: The information panel has an additional icon indicating its purpose.
* Origins - Can now also be obtained from submerged relics.
additional_info: Sources extracted from the 3.82 version of the REWARDTABLE.MBIN game file.

title: Handful of Cogs
summary: Handful of Cogs is a tradeable item useful only for scrap.
game_description: A valuable piece of broken down Trade Terminal.
source_info: Created by a Starship Outfitting Terminal at a Space Station when the player chooses "Claim Scrap" menu option to salvage their starship into Units.
use_info:
Component is useful only as scrap to be sold at a Trade Terminal.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
additional_info:
* 1-19 pieces are awarded when salvaging a starship.
* Maximum stack size is 25.
* The same icon is used by:
**Subatomic Regulators
**Tank of Coolant
**Welding Soap

title: Heart of the Sun
summary:
Heart of the Sun is a curiosity, also known as the last of 10 unique Atlas Seeds.
It has an important part in The Atlas Path mission.
game_description: An Atlas Seed containing a time-locked quantum cilia suspended in a photonic shell. No others are known to exist.
source_info: The blueprint is given after talking to an Magellan or above is required.
use_info: Required to complete the Final Atlas Interface of the The Atlas Path story line of missions.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a curiosity.
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Modified Quanta and Nanite Cluster.

title: Herox
summary: HeroxÂ is aÂ crafted, found in containers or purchased.
game_description:
Combined neutral alloy with uses that range from pharmacology all the way to heavy industry. Crafted from Ionised Cobalt and Ammonia.

Forms the backbone of galactic alloy trading.
source_info: *Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250
release_history: * Interceptor - Corrected description to list the correct crafting ingredients.

title: Holographic Crankshaft
summary: Holographic Crankshaft is a 4th tier tradeable.
game_description:
Packed and separated data containers for holographic crankshafts.

Real crankshafts are frequently too large, noisy or hard-to-maintain for use in delicate machines. When faced with such a situation, high-tech manufacturers turn to these holographic substitutes.
source_info: Holographic Crankshaft can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all high-wealth Manufacturing Economy star systems. It is also obtainable in some, but not all, medium-wealth systems with this Economy.
use_info:
Holographic Crankshaft can be sold for a profit in any Technology Economy star system.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Introduced as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Stack size in Exosuit general inventory raised from 1 to 5. It has the same icon as:

title: Hypnotic Eye
summary: Hypnotic Eye is a tradeable.
game_description:
The eye is cold, almost frozen, to the touch. Nonetheless, it is impossible to escape the feeling it is somehow still alive.

Extended exposure is not recommended. Do not stare back into the eye. Do not stare back. Do not stare back.
source_info:
* Hypnotic Eye drops when an Abyssal Horror is killed. It will disappear if not picked up within a few seconds of spawning.
* These can be found in Derelict Freighter containers.
* Scrapping a Grafted Eyes upgrade that is attached to your living ship will produce 2 eyes.
release_history:
*Abyss 1.71 - Icon changed.
*Aquarius - Added fishing bait bonuses.

title: Industrial-Grade Battery
summary: Industrial-Grade Battery is a 2nd tier tradeable.
game_description:
A packet of well-isolated industrial batteries.

Heavy-duty batteries are required to power deep level miningoperations
source_info: An Industrial-Grade Battery can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all medium-wealth and high-wealth Power Generation Economy star systems. It is also obtainable in some, but not all, low-wealth systems with this Economy.
use_info:
Industrial-Grade Battery can be sold for a profit in any Mining Economy star system.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Stack size in Exosuit general inventory raised from 1 to 5. It has the same icon as Hull Fracture.
* Waypoint - Type changed, formerly "Tradable Energy Source".

title: Instability Injector
summary: Instability Injector is a 3rd tier tradeable.
game_description:
A jumbled box of instability injectors.

Grand experiments often require a large number of variables to be changed in a very short period of time. An instability injector provides such a service. They can also be used to create chaos in market systems; such unethical behaviour represents an excellent trading opportunity.
source_info: Instability Injector can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all medium-wealth and high-wealth Scientific Economy star systems.
use_info:
Instability Injector can be sold for a profit in any Trading Economy star system.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Stack size in Exosuit general inventory raised from 1 to 5.
* Waypoint - Type changed, formerly "Scientific Components".

title: Ion Capacitor
summary: Ion Capacitor is a 3rd tier tradeable.
game_description:
A reinforced crate of ion capacitors.

These supercapacitors have an incredibly high energy density. In great demand in power generation economies.
source_info: Ion Capacitor can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all medium-wealth and high-wealth Technology Economy star systems.
use_info:
Ion Capacitor can be sold for a profit in any Power Generation Economy star system.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Stack size in Exosuit general inventory raised from 1 to 5.
* Waypoint - Type changed, formerly "Technology Parts".
additional_info:
*Icon is also used by:
** Reinforced Piping
** Suspicious Packet (Tech)

title: Ion Sphere
summary: Ion Sphere is a 4th tier tradeable.
game_description:
A packed crate of ion spheres.

These delicate glass spheres house a small-scale replica of the upper atmosphere. Sparkly and hypnotic to look at, these baubles are also of importance in the manufacture of advanced material alloys.
source_info: Ion Sphere can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all high-wealth Trading Economy star systems. It is also obtainable in some, but not all, medium-wealth systems with this Economy.
use_info:
Ion Sphere can be sold for a profit in any Advanced Materials Economy star system.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Stack size in Exosuit general inventory raised from 1 to 5.
* Waypoint - Type changed, formerly "Trade Commodity".

title: Iridesite
summary: Iridesite is a tradeable that is used for crafting.
game_description:
Advanced light metal alloy traded throughout the galactic Outer Edge. Often used in the interiors of trading shuttles to reduce weight as they ascend from planets with high gravitational fields.

Crafted from Aronium, Magno-Gold and Grantine.
source_info: *Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250
release_history:
* NEXT 1.58 - Icon changed, now it has a mirrored and different colored icon as Rare Metal Element.
* Prisms - Added Synthesis Laboratory as a blueprint source.

title: Lemmium
summary: Lemmium is aÂ tradeableÂ that can be crafted, found or purchased.
game_description:
Pure Ferrite alloy. Crafted from Pure Ferrite and Uranium. 

Used extensively in starship freighter construction due to its sheer strength. A hardcore material popular on the Galactic Trade Network.
source_info: *Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250
release_history:
*Release - Added as a component.
*Atlas Rises - Blueprint changed, formerly used Titanium and Plutonium. Icon changed, formerly used the same as Herox.
*NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Aluminium and Carbon. Now it can also be refined.
*Prisms - Added Synthesis Laboratory as a blueprint source.
additional_info:
*Lemmium is named after Lemmy Kilmister, the founder, lead singer and bassist of the English heavy metal band MotÃ¶rhead. Note additional reference to "hardcore" in the game description.<ref>Will Porter (19 Aug 2016 [https://www.loudersound.com/features/how-i-got-lemmy-into-no-man-s-sky 'How I got Lemmy into No Man's Sky'].</ref>
*The inventory appearance for Lemmium was previously used by Crolium.

title: Living Pearl
summary: Living Pearl is a tradeable that is used for crafting.
game_description:
Born in the hearts of enormous glowing molluscs found deep underwater.

Unlike most pearls, this sample is no unliving calcite. Some trace of the mother-clam's consciousness remains within the gem, giving it a lingering, haunting beauty.
source_info:
thumb|An Armoured Clam with open shells
It can be found in Armoured Clams. Damage will force them to open their shells for a short time, revealing the Living Pearl inside. If it is not taken in the allotted time, the shells will close and the player needs to damage them again. It can also be taken without doing damage by interacting and not getting too close.
release_history: * Abyss 1.71 - Icon changed. It has the same icon as Pearl Offering.

title: Magno-Gold
summary: Magno-Gold is a tradeable.
game_description:
Highly prized and lustrous alloy. Popular with traders of all known primary galactic races. Crafted from Ionised Cobalt and Phosphorus.

Easily recognisable by its bright red glow and strong magnetic field.
source_info: *Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250
release_history:
* Pathfinder - Added as a component, renamed from Magmox to Magno-Gold. 
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Gold and Iron.
* Prisms - Added Synthesis Laboratory as a blueprint source.

title: Mesh Decouplers
summary: Mesh Decouplers is a 3rd tier tradeable.
game_description:
A crate of mesh decouplers.

The creation of high-tech components often involves accidental mesh-coupling. These decouplers are particularly powerful, being able to deploy six prongs simultaneously.
source_info: Six-Pronged Mesh Decoupler can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all medium-wealth and high-wealth Manufacturing Economy star systems.
use_info:
Six-Pronged Mesh Decoupler can be sold for a profit in any Technology Economy star system.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Introduced as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Stack size in Exosuit general inventory raised from 1 to 5.
* Waypoint - Renamed, formerly "Six-Pronged Mesh Decoupler". Type changed, formerly "Industrial Components".

title: Modified Quanta
summary:
Modified Quanta is a curiosity, also known as the 9th of 10 unique Atlas Seeds.
It has an important part in The Atlas Path mission and it is worth 1,000
game_description: This one-of-a-kind Atlas Seed holds an aesthetically pleasing mathematical construct salvaged from the simulation of an alternate reality.
source_info: The blueprint is given after talking to an Viking or above is required.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a curiosity.
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Novae Reclaiment and Viridium.

title: Moon Ether
summary: Moon Ether is a tradeable item.
game_description: A vat of highly volatile liquid. Its fumes are extremely flammable and a function
source_info: Purchaseable in outlaw systems.
use_info:
Component is useful only to be sold at a Trade Terminal.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history: *Outlaws - Added to the game.
additional_info: Selling in non-outlaw systems provides a price mark-up of +150% - +180%.

title: Nanotube Crate
summary: Nanotube Crate is a 1st tier tradeable.
game_description:
A packed crate of carbon nanotubes.

These tiny but incredibly strong tubes are required in the construction of tiny but incredibly strong scientific components.
source_info: Nanotube Crate can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all Advanced Materials Economy star systems.
use_info:
Nanotube Crate can be sold for a profit in any Scientific Economy star system.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history:
* NEXT 1.60 - Renamed from Carbon Nanotubes to Nanotube Crate.
* Waypoint - Type changed, formerly "Advanced Construction Materials".

title: Neural Duct
summary: Neural Duct is a 5th tier tradeable.
game_description:
A box of fresh neural ducts.

Neural ducts are temporary inserts designed for a brief boost of concentration and productivity. Useful everywhere, these are highly valued in trading economies where competition between workers is fierce.
source_info: Neural Duct can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all high-wealth Scientific Economy star systems.
use_info:
Neural Duct can be sold for a profit in any Trading Economy star system.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Stack size in Exosuit general inventory raised from 1 to 5. Its inventory appearance appears to be a recoloured and rotated Stasis Device, save for the extra object to the side. Value changes to 50,000.
* Waypoint - Type changed, formerly "Scientific Components".

title: Neutron Microscope
summary: Neutron Microscope is a 2nd tier tradeable.
game_description:
A parcel of neutron microscopes.

Scientific economies produce and consume large numbers of microscopes. However, some have slight defects that render them unsuitable for precision work. These are still a trading opportunity, in that they can be sold to those unable to tell the difference.
source_info: Neutron Microscope can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all medium-wealth and high-wealth Scientific Economy star systems. It is also obtainable in some, but not all, low-wealth systems with this Economy.
use_info:
Neutron Microscope can be sold for a profit in any Trading Economy star system.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Stack size in Exosuit general inventory raised from 1 to 5.
* Waypoint - Type changed, formerly "Scientific Components".

title: Non-Stick Piston
summary: Non-Stick Piston is a 2nd tier tradeable.
game_description:
Wrapped and greased pistons, ready for shipping.

High-tech components frequently require rapidly moving parts, or high-endurance motors. Without specially coated pistons, the failure rate of such parts would be significantly higher.
source_info: Non-Stick Piston can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all medium-wealth and high-wealth Manufacturing Economy star systems. It is also obtainable in some, but not all, low-wealth systems with this Economy.
use_info:
Non-Stick Piston can be sold for a profit in any Technology Economy star system.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Introduced as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Stack size in Exosuit general inventory raised from 1 to 5. It has the same icon as Quad Servo.
* Waypoint - Type changed, formerly "Industrial Components".

title: Noospheric Orb
summary:
Noospheric Orb is a curiosity, also known as the 3rd of 10 unique Atlas Seeds.
It has an important part in The Atlas Path mission and it is worth 1,000
game_description: An Atlas Seed capable of resonating on humanoid telepathic frequencies; may attempt to subsume any subordinate intellect in close proximity.
source_info: The blueprint is given after talking to an Rosetta or above is required.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a curiosity.
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Englobed Shade and Nickel.

title: Novae Reclaiment
summary:
Novae Reclaiment is a curiosity, also known as the 8th of 10 unique Atlas Seeds.
It has an important part in The Atlas Path mission and it is worth 1,000
game_description: Atlas Seed contains neutronium elements from a catastrophic supernova event that obliterated a sentient civilization in an earlier era.
source_info: The blueprint is given after talking to an Hubble or above is required.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a curiosity.
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used State Phasure and Rubeum.

title: Ohmic Gel
summary: Ohmic Gel is a 3rd tier tradeable.
game_description:
Several packets of ohmic gel.

Power-hungry mining operations are fraught with danger. Ohmic gel helps keep rapidly moving parts both insulated and lubricated.
source_info: Ohmic Gel can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all medium-wealth and high-wealth Power Generation Economy star systems.
use_info:
Ohmic Gel can be sold for a profit in any Mining Economy star system.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Stack size in Exosuit general inventory raised from 1 to 5.
* Waypoint - Type changed, formerly "Tradable Energy Source".

title: Once-Useful Springs
summary: Once-Useful Springs is a tradeable.
game_description: A valuable piece of broken down Trade Terminal.
source_info: Sometimes created by a Starship Outfitting Terminal at a Space Station when the player chooses "Claim Scrap" menu option to salvage their starship into Units.
use_info:
Component is useful only as scrap to be sold at a Trade Terminal.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
additional_info:
* 0-10 pieces are awarded when salvaging a starship.
* Maximum stack size is 25.
* Same icon is used by:
** Decommissioned Circuit Board
** Recycled Circuitry

title: Optical Solvent
summary: Optical Solvent is a 3rd tier tradeable.
game_description:
Several bottles of optical solvent.

The liquid in these bottles is used to wash away surplus light that may otherwise cause decay in scientific components.
source_info: Optical Solvent can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all medium-wealth and high-wealth Advanced Materials Economy star systems.
use_info:
Optical Solvent can be sold for a profit in any Scientific Economy star system.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Introduced as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Stack size in Exosuit general inventory raised from 1 to 5.
* Waypoint - Type changed, formerly "Advanced Construction Materials".

title: Organic Piping
summary: Organic Piping is a 4th tier tradeable.
game_description:
A vat of preserved organic piping. Still warm.

To avoid difficult ethical problems, many labs grow their test subjects on a component level. The leftovers can be profitable in trading economies with relaxed medical regulations.
source_info: Organic Piping can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all high-wealth Scientific Economy star systems. It is also obtainable in some, but not all, medium-wealth systems with this Economy.
use_info:
Organic Piping can be sold for a profit in any Trading Economy star system.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Stack size in Exosuit general inventory raised from 1 to 5. It has the same icon as Boiler Unit and Mineral Compressor, while Oxygen Filter has a different colored icon.
* Waypoint - Type changed, formerly "Scientific Components".

title: Photic Jade
summary:
Photic Jade is a curiosity, also known as the 6th of 10 unique Atlas Seeds.
It has an important part in The Atlas Path mission and it is worth 1,000
game_description: This irreplaceable Atlas Seed is a form of matter-adapted photons coalesced into physical solidity by unknown means.
source_info: The blueprint is given after talking to an Dawn or above is required.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a curiosity.
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Dawn's End and Emeril.

title: Prismatic Feathers
summary: Prismatic Feathers is a tradeable item.
game_description:
A vacuum-sealed bundle of dazzlingly beautiful feathers. The animal that gave its life for this impossible, kaleidoscopic charm is long since extinct.

Purchase is illegal at nearly all galactic trade terminals. Regular supply is only available within outlaw systems.

Selling banned goods into commercially-regulated space may be highly profitable.
source_info: Purchaseable in outlaw systems.
use_info:
Component is useful only to be sold at a Trade Terminal.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history: *Outlaws - Added to the game.
additional_info: Selling in non-outlaw systems provides a price mark-up of +150% - +180%.

title: Quantum Accelerator
summary: Quantum Accelerator is a 5th tier tradeable that is produced by a Technology Economy, and particularly sought after in a Power Generation Economy.
game_description:
Several large quantum accelerator units.

Capable of propelling matter at unmeasurable speeds, these units are particularly important in power generation economies, where they're used to compress the energy stored in high-grade batteries.
source_info: Quantum Accelerator can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all high-wealth Technology Economy star systems.
use_info:
Quantum Accelerator can be sold for a profit in any Power Generation Economy star system.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Stack size in Exosuit general inventory raised from 1 to 5. It has the same icon as Cooling System and certain Upgrade Module types.
* Waypoint - Type changed, formerly "Technology Parts".

title: Recycled Circuitry
summary: Recycled Circuitry is a tradeable useful only for scrap.
game_description: A valuable piece of broken down Trade Terminal.
source_info: Sometimes created by a Starship Outfitting Terminal at a Space Station when the player chooses "Claim Scrap" menu option to salvage their starship into Units.
use_info:
Component is useful only as scrap to be sold at a Trade Terminal.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history:
* Synthesis - Introduced as a tradeable.
* Waypoint - Icon changed, previously shared icon with Decommissioned Circuits; value changed, was 600,000.0
additional_info:
* 0-13 pieces are awarded when salvaging a starship.
* Maximum stack size is 25.
* Same icon is used by Superconducting Fibre

title: Reinforced Piping
summary: Reinforced Piping is a tradeable item useful only for scrap.
game_description: A valuable piece of broken down Trade Terminal.
source_info: Sometimes created by a Starship Outfitting Terminal at a Space Station when the player chooses "Claim Scrap" menu option to salvage their starship into Units.
use_info:
Component is useful only as scrap to be sold at a Trade Terminal.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
additional_info:
* 0-26 pieces are awarded when salvaging a starship.
* Maximum stack size is 25.
* The icon is also used by:
** Ion Capacitor
** Suspicious Packet (Tech)

title: Sac Venom
summary:
Sac Venom is a trade commodities.

It can be revealed with 35px icon.
game_description: Stabilized poison sample initially produced by aquatic urchin creatures. A rare and expensive item on the Galactic Trade Network.
source_info:
Sac Venom can be found by destroying urchin-like creatures found on planetary surfaces and under the water. Like other high value non-stackable trading commodities, some planets have an abundance of these.

With assistance from a Farmer, Sac Venom also be grown as a product of the Venom Urchin plant, with a harvest time of 3 hours 20 minutes.
release_history:
* Release - Added as a trade commodity.
* Atlas Rises - Value changed, previously it was worth 26,125.0
additional_info: If found in the wild, picking one up will immediately give the player a three-star wanted level. Once a player begins mining Sac Venom, two drones and a Sentinel Quad are dispatched to interfere.

title: Self-Repairing Heridium
summary: Self-Repairing Heridium is a 2nd tier tradeable.
game_description:
A hopper of self-repairing Heridium. It looks fresh.

Used in the creation of scientific components. Self-repairing heridium is particularly useful for deployment in remote facilities, where maintenance opportunities may be limited or deadly.
source_info: Self-Repairing Heridium can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all medium-wealth and high-wealth Advanced Materials Economy star systems. It is also obtainable in some, but not all, low-wealth systems with this Economy.
use_info:
Self-Repairing Heridium can be sold for a profit in any Scientific Economy star system.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Introduced as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Stack size in Exosuit general inventory raised from 1 to 5.
* Waypoint - Type changed, formerly "Advanced Construction Materials".

title: Spark Canister
summary: Spark Canister is a 1st tier tradeable.
game_description:
A crate packed with spark canisters.

Many industrial and mining processes have considerable power demands. A counterpart to the slow release of a battery, spark canisters are able to meet these demands instantaneously.
source_info: Spark Canister can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all Power Generation Economy star systems. It can also be found in lockers on Derelict Freighter encounters.
use_info:
Spark Canister can be sold for a profit in any Mining Economy star system.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Stack size in Exosuit general inventory raised from 1 to 5
* Waypoint - Type changed, formerly "Tradable Energy Source".

title: Spool of Nano-Cables
summary: Spool of Nano-Cables is a tradeable item.
game_description: A valuable piece of broken down Trade Terminal.
source_info: Sometimes created by a Starship Outfitting Terminal at a Space Station when the player chooses "Claim Scrap" menu option to salvage their starship into Units.
use_info:
thumb|Speaking to an Autophage.
Component can be sold at a Trade Terminal. When speaking with an Autophage, the choice to "Present a gift" sometimes suggests "1 Spool of Nano-Cables" which will increase standing.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history:
* Synthesis - Added as a tradeable.
* Waypoint - Icon changed, used same icon as Ion Capacitor and Reinforced Piping before.
additional_info:
* 0-15 piece is awarded when salvaging a starship.
* Maximum stack size is 25.

title: Star Silk
summary: Star Silk is a 2nd tier tradeable.
game_description:
Several spools of star silk.

Star silk is woven on enormous solar looms in orbit around trading planets. Cosmic ray impact triggers the pattern of the weave, which can then be used in advanced material processing.
source_info: Star Silk can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all medium-wealth and high-wealth Trading Economy star systems. It is also obtainable in some, but not all, low-wealth systems with this Economy.
use_info:
Star Silk can be sold for a profit in any Advanced Materials Economy star system.

Star Silk is used to craft the Classic Armchair which is available from the Quicksilver Synthesis Companion aboard the Space Anomaly.

It is used as an upgrade material for some Planetary Settlement buildings.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Stack size in Exosuit general inventory raised from 1 to 5.
* Waypoint - Type changed, formerly "Trade Commodity".
* Beacon - Used as upgrade material for new settlement building upgrade process.

title: Starship AI Valves
summary: Starship AI Valves are a tradeable item useful only for selling.
game_description: A valuable piece of broken down Trade Terminal.
source_info:
Most often created by a Starship Outfitting Terminal at a Space Station when the player chooses the "Claim Scrap" menu option to salvage an expensive starship and receive Units in the form of scrap. The starship in question must have a reclaim value that is a bit higher than 50,000,000 units. If the sole condition is met on scrapping, the player receives, in total, a full stack of either Geodesite or Iridesite, a full stack of a random activated stellar metal, and one unit of Starship AI Valves along with the regular scrap component yield.
It can also be gifted from Planetary Settlement visitors.

It is extremely valuable.
use_info:
Component is useful only as scrap to be sold at a Trade Terminal.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.

It is commonly used as a way to transfer money, or store it due to it having a high value in the game.
release_history:
* Synthesis - Added as a tradeable.
* Waypoint - Value changed to 12,000,000, was 50,000,000
additional_info:
* Maximum stack size is 50, or 15 on "Harsh" stack size setting.

* This was previously the most valuable item, but that title has now been taken by Stasis Device and Fusion Ignitor.

* A stack of Starship AI Valves is the most valuable stack in the game due to the high stack size (compared to similar value items like Stasis Device and Fusion Ignitor).

title: Stasis Device
summary: Stasis Device is a tradeable that can be crafted.
game_description:
A device specifically crafted to keep lifeforms alive for thousands of years longer than their natural lifespan. Such a device requires great skill to manufacture, as not only is it technically complex, but the consequences for a user in the event of malfunction would be disastrous.

Crafted from Quantum Processors, Cryogenic Chambers, and Iridesite.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from Manufacturing Facilites or purchased from the Synthesis Laboratory for 250
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a product.
* Visions - Value changed, previously it was worth 18,000,000.0
additional_info: It is tied with the Fusion Ignitor for most valuable singular item in the game.

title: State Phasure
summary:
State Phasure is a curiosity, also known as the 7th of 10 unique Atlas Seeds.
It has an important part in The Atlas Path mission and it is worth 1,000
game_description: For unknown reasons, this unique Atlas Seed has been phased out of alignment with this quantum reality. Contents cannot be determined.
source_info: The blueprint is given after talking to an Curiosity or above is required.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a curiosity.
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Photic Jade and Cymatygen.
* Beyond - It has the same, but a different colored icon as Soul Engine.

title: Stolen DNA Samples
summary: Stolen DNA Samples is a tradeable item.
game_description:
Sealed vials of unregistered DNA samples, free of the standard biosecurity mechanisms that prevent unlawful genetic tampering.

Purchase is illegal at nearly all galactic trade terminals. Regular supply is only available within outlaw systems.

Selling banned goods into commercially-regulated space may be highly profitable.
source_info: Purchaseable in outlaw systems.
use_info:
Component is useful only to be sold at a Trade Terminal.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history: *Outlaws - Added to the game.
additional_info: Selling in non-outlaw systems provides a price mark-up of +150% - +180%.

title: Storm Crystal
summary:
Storm Crystal is a extreme weather planets.

During Extreme storms it can be located with the 35px|link= icon. It can also easily be found visually due to its bright glow.
game_description: A rare and highly valuable cluster of storm crystals. These crystalline structures thrive in stormy conditions, and naturally attract lighting strikes, becoming spectacularly luminescent when ionised. Exclusively found on  extreme weather planets.
source_info:
It can be harvested on extreme weather planets during storms. Look for planets with activated minerals and search during a storm. Not all extreme weather or activated mineral planets have storm crystals.

Other sources:
*From the Mercenaries Guild envoy aboard space stations (~14.5%)
*Certain Nexus missions (8.5%)
*Analysing a Crystal Fragment (5%)
*Derelict Freighter Crates (5%)
*Suspicious Packet (Goods) (3%)
*From Bounty Hunter missions in outlaw systems (3%)
*Mission Board Missions (~0.7%)
release_history:
*Visions - Added as a curiosity.
*Living Ship - value changed to 85,368.1 units
*Desolation - can be found on Derelict Freighters
*Origins - value changed back to 129,150.0 units.
*Waypoint - value changed to 211,150.0 units.
*Worlds Part II - can now be found on

title: Superconducting Fibre
summary: Superconducting Fibre is a 1st tier tradeable.
game_description:
A densely layered package of superconducting fibres.

Powerful, flexible, and water-resistant; the controlled magnetic weave of these fibres is vital in the creation of many scientific components.
source_info: Superconducting Fibre can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all high-wealth Advanced Materials Economy star systems.
use_info:
Superconducting Fibre can be sold for a profit in any Scientific Economy star system.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.

A bundle of precisely calibrated teleport coordinators.

These pin-prick sized circuits are vital to the delicate process of inserting reinforcing material into advanced alloys. They can also aid long-distance sales efforts.

* Waypoint - Renamed, formerly "High Capacity Vector Compressor". Type changed, formerly "Industrial Components".

title: Vigilant Stone
summary: Vigilant Stone is a tradeable.
game_description:
An eye of living stone: waiting, watching. A relic left by a slumbering guardian, keeping sentry over ancient creature burial grounds.

Warning: Disturbing the eye may disturb the slumber of living stone guardians. Ensure re-animated guardians are defeated before storing this relic in the home.

when you find a vigilant stone, be prepared to fight, run, or have your ship near you. Stone guardians are a serious jump scare. They are only to be messed with by the most insanely brave individual. Shooting them with your shipâs weapons also works.
source_info: * On planets with Ancient Bones, near fossils. Shows up on analysis visor.

title: Vile cortex
summary: Vile Cortex is a Trophy.
game_description:
The brain stem of a Brood Mother, pulled from its malignant corpse.

This is a valuable trophy, signifying victory in the quest to purge the infestations of the vile brood. Turn it over to an envoy of the Mercenaries Guild to mark your triumph.
source_info: * Loot from a Brood Mother.

title: Vortex Cube
summary:
Vortex Cube is a trade commodities (small "c"). 

It can be found in and around caves on certain planets.
game_description:
An ancient object, unearthed from the depths of a planetary cave system. Its surface is cold to the touch, and is curiously polished despite its age.

A fusion of metal and rock, these cubes have proved resistant to industrial processing. As such, they are of value only to collectors.

Can be sold at a Galactic Trade Terminal.
release_history:
* Release - Added as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - It is no longer used for crafting, as the related technologies were made obsolete. Value changed, previously was 24,750.0.
* Visions - The information panel has an additional icon indicating its purpose.
* Origins - Vortex Cubes no longer drop TetraCobalt.

title: Vy'keen Dagger
summary: '''Vy'keen Dagger''' is a trade commodities.
game_description: Largely ceremonial weapon. A vital part of Vy'keen tradition and culture.
source_info:
* It can be found in Damaged Containers or as monolith rewards. 
* It can also be bought from NPCs in Trading Posts
* It is a possible reward from frigate expeditions.
* It is also a possible trade from wandering traders you encounter while using the Pulse Engine.
* It can also be salvaged from containers on a Derelict Freighter
* It is a possible reward from NPCs at Space Stations for practicing language skills well.
*It can be rewarded to a player by interacting with and pleasing Vy'keen Corporal NPCs.
release_history:
* Release - Introduced to the game.
* NEXT - Value changed, previously it was worth 20,625
additional_info:
* It can be used when interacting with a monolith in Vy'keen systems to reveal the location of the portal for the planet.
* It can be given to Vy'keen in some NPC interactions to increase standing.
* Two are required during the Weapons Research secondary missions.
* It can be used in Secured Facilities in Vy'keen systems to override security, allowing access. 
* Three daggers may be needed to take command of a settlement in Vy'keen systems.

title: Welding Soap
summary: Welding Soap is a 2nd tier tradeable.
game_description:
Several large bars of welding soap.

Used in power generation systems to heat-clean metal diodes before they're fused into batteries.
source_info: Welding Soap can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all medium-wealth and high-wealth Technology Economy star systems. It is also obtainable in some, but not all, low-wealth systems with this Economy.
use_info:
Welding Soap can be sold for a profit in any Power Generation Economy star system.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.

Welding Soap can be used as certain (Synthesis Plant C->B) Settlement buildings upgrades.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Stack size in Exosuit general inventory raised from 1 to 5.
* Waypoint - Type changed, formerly "Technology Parts".
additional_info:
The same icon is used by:
*Handful of Cogs
*Subatomic Regulators
*Tank of Coolant
